Dear Roshni,

Our renewals are on September 24.

KYC requirements are more strict this year. That is why there is delay in the policy issuance.

Usually, the policies should be ready by mid-November. But the central bank has become tighter on regulation.

In all cases, we have cover confirmation for all entities so insurance is active and the bank guarantees are still in force.

Hopefully, within two weeks we can have the originals in hand.

As for estimated timelines for documents to relay to the banks, it is 6-8 weeks for policy issuance and around 16-20 weeks for premium payment receipt as our payment terms and 120 days.

Thanks for your patience and hopefully we have this issue sorted soon.

Best Regards,
Hagop

Cc: Michelle Cantalejo <Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com>
Subject: RE: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy 
 

Hi Hagop,

 

I hope all is well.

 

We seem to be constantly following up for these documents as we are being chased constantly by our partner banks - is there a better way to manage the process?

 

The banks require these as we have provided them with the policies as security, as you probably know. Can you provide rough timelines for the renewal process and to receive original copies so we can manage expectations with the banks?

 

In addition, are these timelines realistic or do we need to also push the provider to deliver quickly.

 

Many thanks

Roshni

 

ROSHNI RAMACHANDRAN​​​​

MANAGER ‑ TREASURY

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

Subject: Re: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy

 

Dear Roshni,

 

Our renewals are on September 24.

 

KYC requirements are more strict this year. That is why there is delay in the policy issuance.

metadata.doc_id: C18LR25 - allied enterprises llc - insurance policy\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\C18LR25 - allied enterprises llc - insurance policy\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
That is why there is delay in the policy issuance.

 

Usually, the policies should be ready by mid-November. But the central bank has become tighter on regulation.

 

In all cases, we have cover confirmation for all entities so insurance is active and the bank guarantees are still in force.

 

Hopefully, within two weeks we can have the originals in hand.

 

As for estimated timelines for documents to relay to the banks, it is 6-8 weeks for policy issuance and around 16-20 weeks for premium payment receipt as our payment terms and 120 days.

 

Thanks for your patience and hopefully we have this issue sorted soon.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

________________________________

From: Roshni Ramachandran <Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com <mailto:Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com> >

Cc: Michelle Cantalejo <Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com <mailto:Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: RE: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy 

 

Hi Hagop,

 

I hope all is well.

 

We seem to be constantly following up for these documents as we are being chased constantly by our partner banks - is there a better way to manage the process?

 

The banks require these as we have provided them with the policies as security, as you probably know. Can you provide rough timelines for the renewal process and to receive original copies so we can manage expectations with the banks?

 

In addition, are these timelines realistic or do we need to also push the provider to deliver quickly.

Subject: Re: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy

 

Dear Roshni,

 

Our renewals are on September 24.

 

KYC requirements are more strict this year. That is why there is delay in the policy issuance.

 

Usually, the policies should be ready by mid-November. But the central bank has become tighter on regulation.

 

In all cases, we have cover confirmation for all entities so insurance is active and the bank guarantees are still in force.

 

Hopefully, within two weeks we can have the originals in hand.

Hopefully, within two weeks we can have the originals in hand.

 

As for estimated timelines for documents to relay to the banks, it is 6-8 weeks for policy issuance and around 16-20 weeks for premium payment receipt as our payment terms and 120 days.

 

Thanks for your patience and hopefully we have this issue sorted soon.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

Hi Hagop,

 

I hope all is well.

 

We seem to be constantly following up for these documents as we are being chased constantly by our partner banks - is there a better way to manage the process?

 

The banks require these as we have provided them with the policies as security, as you probably know. Can you provide rough timelines for the renewal process and to receive original copies so we can manage expectations with the banks?

 

In addition, are these timelines realistic or do we need to also push the provider to deliver quickly.

 

Many thanks

Roshni

Neeku

From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> > 
Sent: Thursday, November 21, 2024 8:07 PM
To: Roshni Ramachandran <Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com <mailto:Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com> >; Neeku Dsouza <Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com <mailto:Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Michelle Cantalejo <Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com <mailto:Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: Re: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy

 

Dear Roshni,

 

Our renewals are on September 24.

 

KYC requirements are more strict this year. That is why there is delay in the policy issuance.

 

Usually, the policies should be ready by mid-November. But the central bank has become tighter on regulation.

 

In all cases, we have cover confirmation for all entities so insurance is active and the bank guarantees are still in force.

 

Hopefully, within two weeks we can have the originals in hand.

 

As for estimated timelines for documents to relay to the banks, it is 6-8 weeks for policy issuance and around 16-20 weeks for premium payment receipt as our payment terms and 120 days.

 

Thanks for your patience and hopefully we have this issue sorted soon.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

________________________________

Cc: Michelle Cantalejo <Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com <mailto:Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: RE: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy 

 

Hi Hagop,

 

I hope all is well.

 

We seem to be constantly following up for these documents as we are being chased constantly by our partner banks - is there a better way to manage the process?

 

The banks require these as we have provided them with the policies as security, as you probably know. Can you provide rough timelines for the renewal process and to receive original copies so we can manage expectations with the banks?

 

In addition, are these timelines realistic or do we need to also push the provider to deliver quickly.

 

Many thanks

Roshni

 

ROSHNI RAMACHANDRAN​​​​

MANAGER ‑ TREASURY

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> > 
Sent: Thursday, November 21, 2024 8:07 PM
To: Roshni Ramachandran <Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com <mailto:Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com> >; Neeku Dsouza <Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com <mailto:Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Michelle Cantalejo <Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com <mailto:Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: Re: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy

 

Dear Roshni,

 

Our renewals are on September 24.

 

KYC requirements are more strict this year. That is why there is delay in the policy issuance.

 

Usually, the policies should be ready by mid-November. But the central bank has become tighter on regulation.

 

In all cases, we have cover confirmation for all entities so insurance is active and the bank guarantees are still in force.

 

Hopefully, within two weeks we can have the originals in hand.

 

As for estimated timelines for documents to relay to the banks, it is 6-8 weeks for policy issuance and around 16-20 weeks for premium payment receipt as our payment terms and 120 days.

 

Thanks for your patience and hopefully we have this issue sorted soon.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

________________________________

com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Michelle Cantalejo <Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com <mailto:Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: RE: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy 

 

Hi Hagop,

 

I hope all is well.

 

We seem to be constantly following up for these documents as we are being chased constantly by our partner banks - is there a better way to manage the process?

 

The banks require these as we have provided them with the policies as security, as you probably know. Can you provide rough timelines for the renewal process and to receive original copies so we can manage expectations with the banks?

 

In addition, are these timelines realistic or do we need to also push the provider to deliver quickly.

 

Many thanks

Roshni

 

ROSHNI RAMACHANDRAN​​​​

oub.com <mailto:Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Michelle Cantalejo <Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com <mailto:Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: Re: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy

 

Dear Roshni,

 

Our renewals are on September 24.

 

KYC requirements are more strict this year. That is why there is delay in the policy issuance.

 

Usually, the policies should be ready by mid-November. But the central bank has become tighter on regulation.

 

In all cases, we have cover confirmation for all entities so insurance is active and the bank guarantees are still in force.

 

Hopefully, within two weeks we can have the originals in hand.

 

As for estimated timelines for documents to relay to the banks, it is 6-8 weeks for policy issuance and around 16-20 weeks for premium payment receipt as our payment terms and 120 days.

 

Thanks for your patience and hopefully we have this issue sorted soon.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

________________________________

We seem to be constantly following up for these documents as we are being chased constantly by our partner banks - is there a better way to manage the process?

 

The banks require these as we have provided them with the policies as security, as you probably know. Can you provide rough timelines for the renewal process and to receive original copies so we can manage expectations with the banks?

 

In addition, are these timelines realistic or do we need to also push the provider to deliver quickly.

 

Many thanks

Roshni

 

ROSHNI RAMACHANDRAN​​​​

Good Morning 

I hope all is well.

Please could you share the Allied insurance (with the standard Mashreq endorsement clause; GIG POLICY 3 13/FA/33913/0/41) and the credit confirmation letter/ any other certificate from the insurance company in the absence of the PPR.

Many thanks,

Neeku

From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> > 
Sent: Thursday, November 21, 2024 8:07 PM
To: Roshni Ramachandran <Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com <mailto:Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com> >; Neeku Dsouza <Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com <mailto:Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Michelle Cantalejo <Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com <mailto:Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: Re: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy

 

Dear Roshni,

 

Our renewals are on September 24.

 

KYC requirements are more strict this year. That is why there is delay in the policy issuance.

 

Usually, the policies should be ready by mid-November. But the central bank has become tighter on regulation.

 

In all cases, we have cover confirmation for all entities so insurance is active and the bank guarantees are still in force.

 

Hopefully, within two weeks we can have the originals in hand.

chunks.text:
Hopefully, within two weeks we can have the originals in hand.

 

As for estimated timelines for documents to relay to the banks, it is 6-8 weeks for policy issuance and around 16-20 weeks for premium payment receipt as our payment terms and 120 days.

 

Thanks for your patience and hopefully we have this issue sorted soon.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

________________________________

From: Roshni Ramachandran <Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com <mailto:Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com> >
Sent: 21 November 2024 5:47 PM
To: Neeku Dsouza <Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com <mailto:Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com> >; Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Michelle Cantalejo <Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com <mailto:Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: RE: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy 

 

Hi Hagop,

 

I hope all is well.

 

We seem to be constantly following up for these documents as we are being chased constantly by our partner banks - is there a better way to manage the process?

 

The banks require these as we have provided them with the policies as security, as you probably know. Can you provide rough timelines for the renewal process and to receive original copies so we can manage expectations with the banks?

 

In addition, are these timelines realistic or do we need to also push the provider to deliver quickly.

 

Many thanks

Roshni

 

ROSHNI RAMACHANDRAN​​​​

MANAGER ‑ TREASURY

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> > 
Sent: Thursday, November 21, 2024 8:07 PM
To: Roshni Ramachandran <Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com <mailto:Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com> >; Neeku Dsouza <Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com <mailto:Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Michelle Cantalejo <Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com <mailto:Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: Re: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy

 

Dear Roshni,

 

Our renewals are on September 24.

 

KYC requirements are more strict this year. That is why there is delay in the policy issuance.

 

Usually, the policies should be ready by mid-November. But the central bank has become tighter on regulation.

 

In all cases, we have cover confirmation for all entities so insurance is active and the bank guarantees are still in force.

 

Hopefully, within two weeks we can have the originals in hand.

chunks.text:
Hopefully, within two weeks we can have the originals in hand.

 

As for estimated timelines for documents to relay to the banks, it is 6-8 weeks for policy issuance and around 16-20 weeks for premium payment receipt as our payment terms and 120 days.

 

Thanks for your patience and hopefully we have this issue sorted soon.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

________________________________

From: Roshni Ramachandran <Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com <mailto:Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com> >
Sent: 21 November 2024 5:47 PM
To: Neeku Dsouza <Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com <mailto:Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com> >; Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Michelle Cantalejo <Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com <mailto:Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: RE: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy 

 

Hi Hagop,

 

I hope all is well.

 

We seem to be constantly following up for these documents as we are being chased constantly by our partner banks - is there a better way to manage the process?

 

The banks require these as we have provided them with the policies as security, as you probably know. Can you provide rough timelines for the renewal process and to receive original copies so we can manage expectations with the banks?

 

In addition, are these timelines realistic or do we need to also push the provider to deliver quickly.

 

Many thanks

Roshni

 

ROSHNI RAMACHANDRAN​​​​

MANAGER ‑ TREASURY

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> > 
Sent: Thursday, November 21, 2024 8:07 PM
To: Roshni Ramachandran <Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com <mailto:Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com> >; Neeku Dsouza <Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com <mailto:Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Michelle Cantalejo <Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com <mailto:Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: Re: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy

 

Dear Roshni,

 

Our renewals are on September 24.

 

KYC requirements are more strict this year. That is why there is delay in the policy issuance.

 

Usually, the policies should be ready by mid-November. But the central bank has become tighter on regulation.

 

In all cases, we have cover confirmation for all entities so insurance is active and the bank guarantees are still in force.

 

Hopefully, within two weeks we can have the originals in hand.

chunks.text:
Hopefully, within two weeks we can have the originals in hand.

 

As for estimated timelines for documents to relay to the banks, it is 6-8 weeks for policy issuance and around 16-20 weeks for premium payment receipt as our payment terms and 120 days.

 

Thanks for your patience and hopefully we have this issue sorted soon.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

________________________________

From: Roshni Ramachandran <Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com <mailto:Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com> >
Sent: 21 November 2024 5:47 PM
To: Neeku Dsouza <Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com <mailto:Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com> >; Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Michelle Cantalejo <Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com <mailto:Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: RE: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy 

 

Hi Hagop,

 

I hope all is well.

 

We seem to be constantly following up for these documents as we are being chased constantly by our partner banks - is there a better way to manage the process?

 

The banks require these as we have provided them with the policies as security, as you probably know. Can you provide rough timelines for the renewal process and to receive original copies so we can manage expectations with the banks?

 

In addition, are these timelines realistic or do we need to also push the provider to deliver quickly.

 

Many thanks

Roshni

 

ROSHNI RAMACHANDRAN​​​​

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

Sent: Thursday, November 21, 2024 8:07 PM
To: Roshni Ramachandran <Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com <mailto:Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com> >; Neeku Dsouza <Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com <mailto:Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Michelle Cantalejo <Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com <mailto:Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: Re: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy

 

Dear Roshni,

 

Our renewals are on September 24.

 

KYC requirements are more strict this year. That is why there is delay in the policy issuance.

 

Usually, the policies should be ready by mid-November. But the central bank has become tighter on regulation.

 

In all cases, we have cover confirmation for all entities so insurance is active and the bank guarantees are still in force.

 

Hopefully, within two weeks we can have the originals in hand.

 

As for estimated timelines for documents to relay to the banks, it is 6-8 weeks for policy issuance and around 16-20 weeks for premium payment receipt as our payment terms and 120 days.

 

Thanks for your patience and hopefully we have this issue sorted soon.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

________________________________

Subject: RE: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy 

 

Hi Hagop,

 

I hope all is well.

 

We seem to be constantly following up for these documents as we are being chased constantly by our partner banks - is there a better way to manage the process?

 

The banks require these as we have provided them with the policies as security, as you probably know. Can you provide rough timelines for the renewal process and to receive original copies so we can manage expectations with the banks?

 

In addition, are these timelines realistic or do we need to also push the provider to deliver quickly.

 

Many thanks

Roshni

 

ROSHNI RAMACHANDRAN​​​​

Subject: Re: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy

 

Dear Roshni,

 

Our renewals are on September 24.

 

KYC requirements are more strict this year. That is why there is delay in the policy issuance.

 

Usually, the policies should be ready by mid-November. But the central bank has become tighter on regulation.

 

In all cases, we have cover confirmation for all entities so insurance is active and the bank guarantees are still in force.

 

Hopefully, within two weeks we can have the originals in hand.

Hopefully, within two weeks we can have the originals in hand.

 

As for estimated timelines for documents to relay to the banks, it is 6-8 weeks for policy issuance and around 16-20 weeks for premium payment receipt as our payment terms and 120 days.

 

Thanks for your patience and hopefully we have this issue sorted soon.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

Subject: RE: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy 

 

Hi Hagop,

 

I hope all is well.

 

We seem to be constantly following up for these documents as we are being chased constantly by our partner banks - is there a better way to manage the process?

 

The banks require these as we have provided them with the policies as security, as you probably know. Can you provide rough timelines for the renewal process and to receive original copies so we can manage expectations with the banks?

 

In addition, are these timelines realistic or do we need to also push the provider to deliver quickly.

 

Many thanks

Roshni

oub.com <mailto:Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Michelle Cantalejo <Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com <mailto:Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: Re: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy

 

Dear Roshni,

 

Our renewals are on September 24.

 

KYC requirements are more strict this year. That is why there is delay in the policy issuance.

 

Usually, the policies should be ready by mid-November. But the central bank has become tighter on regulation.

 

In all cases, we have cover confirmation for all entities so insurance is active and the bank guarantees are still in force.

 

Hopefully, within two weeks we can have the originals in hand.

 

As for estimated timelines for documents to relay to the banks, it is 6-8 weeks for policy issuance and around 16-20 weeks for premium payment receipt as our payment terms and 120 days.

 

Thanks for your patience and hopefully we have this issue sorted soon.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

________________________________

We seem to be constantly following up for these documents as we are being chased constantly by our partner banks - is there a better way to manage the process?

chunks.text:
We seem to be constantly following up for these documents as we are being chased constantly by our partner banks - is there a better way to manage the process?

 

The banks require these as we have provided them with the policies as security, as you probably know. Can you provide rough timelines for the renewal process and to receive original copies so we can manage expectations with the banks?

 

In addition, are these timelines realistic or do we need to also push the provider to deliver quickly.

 

Many thanks

Roshni

 

ROSHNI RAMACHANDRAN​​​​

MANAGER ‑ TREASURY

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

Subject: Re: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy

 

Dear Roshni,

 

Our renewals are on September 24.

 

KYC requirements are more strict this year. That is why there is delay in the policy issuance.

 

Usually, the policies should be ready by mid-November. But the central bank has become tighter on regulation.

 

In all cases, we have cover confirmation for all entities so insurance is active and the bank guarantees are still in force.

 

Hopefully, within two weeks we can have the originals in hand.

 

As for estimated timelines for documents to relay to the banks, it is 6-8 weeks for policy issuance and around 16-20 weeks for premium payment receipt as our payment terms and 120 days.

 

Thanks for your patience and hopefully we have this issue sorted soon.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

Many thanks

Roshni

From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> >
Sent: Thursday, November 21, 2024 8:07 PM
To: Roshni Ramachandran <Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com <mailto:Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com> >; Neeku Dsouza <Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com <mailto:Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Michelle Cantalejo <Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com <mailto:Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: Re: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy

 

Dear Roshni,

 

Our renewals are on September 24.

 

KYC requirements are more strict this year. That is why there is delay in the policy issuance.

 

Usually, the policies should be ready by mid-November. But the central bank has become tighter on regulation.

 

In all cases, we have cover confirmation for all entities so insurance is active and the bank guarantees are still in force.

 

Hopefully, within two weeks we can have the originals in hand.

chunks.text:
Hopefully, within two weeks we can have the originals in hand.

 

As for estimated timelines for documents to relay to the banks, it is 6-8 weeks for policy issuance and around 16-20 weeks for premium payment receipt as our payment terms and 120 days.

 

Thanks for your patience and hopefully we have this issue sorted soon.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

________________________________

From: Roshni Ramachandran <Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com <mailto:Roshni.Ramachandran@chalhoub.com> >
Sent: 21 November 2024 5:47 PM
To: Neeku Dsouza <Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com <mailto:Neeku.Dsouza@chalhoub.com> >; Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Michelle Cantalejo <Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com <mailto:Michelle.Cantalejo@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: RE: ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC - insurance policy

 

Hi Hagop,

 

I hope all is well.

 

We seem to be constantly following up for these documents as we are being chased constantly by our partner banks - is there a better way to manage the process?

 

The banks require these as we have provided them with the policies as security, as you probably know. Can you provide rough timelines for the renewal process and to receive original copies so we can manage expectations with the banks?

 

In addition, are these timelines realistic or do we need to also push the provider to deliver quickly.

 

Many thanks

Roshni

 

ROSHNI RAMACHANDRAN​​​​

MANAGER ‑ TREASURY

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

+971 4 804 5000
